definition: lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to cheat/to swindle/to pretend/to feign/to draw sb out/to try to extract information by deceit or bluff

sentences.english: But we live in a world of deception .
sentences.chinese: 但是我们生活在一个尔虞我诈世界。

sentences.english: Humans can be an untrusting race.
sentences.chinese: 人类也许是一个尔虞我诈的种族。

definition: to fight and scheme against each other (idiom)/(in palace construction) elaborate and refined
variant of 勾心鬥角|勾心斗角[gou1 xin1 dou4 jiao3]
to fight for fame, grab profit (idiom); scrambling for fame and wealth/only interested in personal gain
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
lit. the weak are prey to the strong (idiom); fig. predatory behavior/the law of the jungle
art of politics/political tricks (often derog.)/power play/to play at politics/underhand trickery
hard to fathom a person's mind (idiom)
